intro: Hypopitys californica, commonly known as the California nutmeg, is a rare and unique plant native to the coastal regions of California. It is a member of the Podocarpaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woody, shrub-like structure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by fleshy, red berries that contain a single seed. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
